intro: Amaioua velutina, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and abandoned fields. Amaioua velutina is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of soil types.
